üìë "Graham Flour is a coarsely ground type of wheat flour that is unbleached, and less processed than whole-wheat flour...production starts by finely grinding the kernel or endosperm of winter wheat. The other parts of the wheat, germ, and bran are also ground and added back to the endosperm grind, resulting in brown colored flour that is slightly sweet." - wisegeek.org
